meanings.sent1: The interarches of the bridge allowed for a strong and stable structure.
meanings.sent2: The hallway was decorated with beautiful interarches that added elegance to the design.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to hide in the interarches of the garden gate.
meanings.sent4: The interarches of the ancient ruins whispered stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: Sunlight streamed through the interarches, creating a magical play of light and shadow.

meanings.definition: To connect or support with arches.
meanings.sent1: The skilled mason used stones to interarches the entrance of the castle.
meanings.sent2: The architect decided to interarches the walkway to ensure its stability.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to interarches their fort with imaginary bridges.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to interarches the hearts of the audience, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The vines interarches the trees in a natural canopy, providing shade in the hot summer days.
